info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 4:37PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN WASHINGTON... SOUTHEASTERN GREENE...FAYETTE...MONONGALIA...NORTHWESTERN PRESTON AND MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 530 PM EST... At 437 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong winds along a line extending from near Fredericktown-Millsboro to 6 miles west of Lumberport. Movement was southeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Fairmont, Uniontown, Connellsville, Westover, Mannington, Star City, California, Masontown, Pleasant Valley, Brownsville, and Winfield. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 18. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 8. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 130 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
